Love: Heliadora's marble forums feel like home under my hooves.
Sunlight on the Aegis bridges always makes me stand taller.
Like: A quick trot through the plazas keeps me limber.
Dislike: These alleys are narrower than I remember.
Too many steps, not enough ramps for a proper gallop.
Hate: Stalls packed this tight make my shoulders ache.

Love: Amatera's mountain air is crisp enough to braid into ribbons.
Snowflake lanterns here melt just slow enough to smile.
Like: I can drift along these bridges all night.
Quiet footsteps and cool river mist suit me.
Dislike: Too many festival fires make the air a bit warm.
Hate: If the drums get any hotter, I'll have to find shade in the hills.

Love: Ziggurab's skyline still shines like cut glass to me.
Home courts mean familiar wishes whispered on the wind.
Like: Market lanterns remind me of star jars back home.
Dislike: So few people here know how to phrase a good wish.
Hate: Sand-choked lamps and rude summons sour my mood.
